data.title: Symantec (SYMC) Stock 10 Year History & Return
data.meta_description: Want to be a successful stock investor? Get insights from 10 year historical return of Symantec Corporation (SYMC) stock in NASDAQ exchange.
data.text:
If you're aiming to achieve success in stock investment, conducting thorough analysis is a key requirement. To facilitate your analysis, this report presents a range of insights extracted from the decade-long performance of Symantec Corporation (SYMC) stock on the NASDAQ exchange.

Upon perusing this document, you'll acquire knowledge about the average yearly yield of Symantec Corporation (SYMC) stock and its comparative performance in relation to broader market indices. Moreover, you'll be able to gauge its relative performance when compared to similar stocks.

Comprising 6 sections, this report is designed to furnish you with invaluable insights pertaining to the ten-year historical trajectory of Symantec Corporation (SYMC) stock.

Please take note that we aim to update this report on a monthly basis, with a minimum frequency of quarterly updates (exceptions might apply). The data used to compile this report spans from November 28, 2010 to November 25, 2020.

Beneath, you'll find a table of contents that will aid you in navigating between the different sections:

SYMC Stock's Price Graph & Average Annual Return

Performance of Symantec Corporation (SYMC) Stock Compared to the Overall Stock Market

How Symantec Corporation (SYMC) Stock Performed Against Large Cap Stocks

SYMC Stock Vs Similar Market Cap Stocks

Top 10 Largest Single-Day Gains

Top 10 Largest Single-Day Losses

1 SYMC Stock's Price Graph & Average Annual Return

SYMC 10-Year Price Performance Graph:

Displayed below is a visual depiction presenting the closing prices of Symantec Corporation (SYMC) spanning the last decade. This particular graph employs adjusted closing prices instead of market closing prices. (The adjusted close takes into account significant corporate or institutional-level actions that occur beyond regular market hours.)

Average Annual Return Over 10 Years:

Let's imagine that you invested in SYMC stock on November 28, 2010, and remained invested for a decade until November 25, 2020. In such a scenario, you can compute the average annual return over these ten years (CAGR) using the formula provided below:

R = 100 x [(EP/SP)^1/10 - 1] where, EP - SYMC price on November 25, 2020 = $18.175 SP - SYMC price on November 28, 2010 = $6.65156 And R represents the annual return.

By plugging in the values, the calculated R-value is as follows: R = 100 x [(18.175/6.65156)1/10 - 1] = 10.57 %

The aforementioned calculated value signifies the past 10-year return of Symantec Corporation (SYMC). For insights into the returns for the current year (2020), kindly refer to the, 2020 performance report of SYMC stock.

Please Note:

The above calculation does not account for dividends (if any).

We've utilized the geometric mean to calculate the average annual return.

An Intriguing Question:

If you had invested 1000 $ in SYMC 10 years ago, how much would your investment have grown by now?

Given that we've just established the annual return to be 10.57%, your investment would now amount to 2731.32$.

2 Performance of Symantec Corporation (SYMC) Stock Compared to the Overall Stock Market

Assessing a stock in isolation might not provide a comprehensive view. Instead, you can glean more valuable insights by evaluating its performance in relation to broad market indices and similar stocks.

This segment presents a comparison of SYMC's performance against the NASDAQ composite index. (You can conceptualize the NASDAQ composite index as a reflection of the overall stock market.)

The graph below juxtaposes the 10-year returns of Symantec Corporation (SYMC) against the NASDAQ composite. The blue line corresponds to SYMC stock, while the red line represents the NASDAQ composite. Both lines illustrate the percentage changes in their respective prices over time.

Company Name10-Year Return (%)Symantec Corporation (SYMC)10.57%NASDAQ (IXIC)15.32%

Consequently, Symantec Corporation (SYMC) has underperformed the NASDAQ composite by 31% over this period . Tweet This

3 How Symantec Corporation (SYMC) Stock Performed Against Large Cap Stocks

Symantec Corporation (SYMC) is classified as a Large-cap stock. (A Large-cap stock holds a market valuation of Over $10 billion USD.)

In the following section, we'll explore how Symantec Corporation (SYMC) stacks up against other Large-cap stocks in the broader context. We've compared the closing prices of Symantec Corporation (SYMC) to those of the Dow Jones Large Cap (DWL) index.

Company Name10-Year Return (%)Symantec Corporation (SYMC)10.57%Dow Jones Large Cap (DWL)11.96%

Consequently, Symantec Corporation (SYMC) has delivered a 12% Lower performance in comparison to Dow Jones Large Cap (DWL). Tweet This

4 SYMC Stock Vs Similar Market Cap Stocks

The following section presents a comparison of Symantec Corporation (SYMC)'s performance alongside that of other companies sharing a similar Market Capitalization. We've analyzed the closing prices of Symantec Corporation (SYMC), as well as those of Icahn Enterprises L.P.(IEP) and argenx SE(ARGX) stocks.

Company Name10-Year Return (%)Symantec Corporation (SYMC)10.57%Icahn Enterprises L.P.(IEP)12.69% argenx SE(ARGX)27.71%

Hence, SYMC has achieved a 17% Lower return in contrast to Icahn Enterprises L.P.(IEP). ALSO, it has delivered a 62% Lower return in comparison to argenx SE(ARGX).

5 Top 10 Largest Single-Day Gains

Important Note: *The last two sections utilize the close prices and not the adjusted close prices.

Understanding the largest one-day gains provides valuable insight into a stock's volatility. Such days often indicate a surge in buying activity, often attributed to factors like favorable earnings reports.

The table presented below illustrates the ten most significant one-day gains recorded by Symantec Corporation (SYMC) stock. Additionally, the table includes the corresponding dates, aiding your analysis of potential triggers behind these price movements.

For those inclined to analyze trends, certain investors attach greater significance to gains and losses over a 52-week period as opposed to longer time frames such as ten years. If you share this perspective, we encourage you to explore the 52 weeks report for SYMC.

Moving forward, let's examine the ten most significant one-day losses incurred by Symantec Corporation (SYMC) stock.

Please bear in mind: Losses often put investor emotions to the test. The fear of loss can lead many to sell at inopportune moments. These are the days when investors may have experienced the most substantial losses.

Conclusion:

With this report, we aim to enhance your understanding of Symantec Corporation (SYMC) shares' performance over the past decade. We invite you to propose any corrections or enhancements to this report. Should you wish to contribute corrections, please make use of the site-wide contact form.

Further Reading: For investors interested in dividend-paying companies, exploring the SYMC dividend history might be insightful.

Disclaimer:

We have validated the data to the best of our knowledge. If you find data inaccuracies kindly let us know using the contact form so that we can act promptly.
